headline: Trump Media Keeps Bitcoin Plan Despite $400M Buyback Move
summary: Despite initial denials, the company confirmed it raised $2.5 billion for Bitcoin purchases via share resales and convertible notes, supported by a registration approved by SEC Chair Paul Atkins. Meanwhile, President Trump‚Äôs broader crypto agenda is under scrutiny. Lawmakers introduced the COIN Act to restrict political figures from crypto involvement, due to ethical concerns. Separately, Panther Metals Plc surged 21% after announcing it would integrate Bitcoin into its own treasury and use it as collateral for mining acquisitions. Stock Buyback Won‚Äôt Stop Trump‚Äôs Bitcoin Plans Trump Media and Technology Group, the company behind the Truth Social platform, announced a $400-million stock buyback program, and explained that the move will not interfere with its previously disclosed plans to build a Bitcoin treasury. In a notice that was released Monday, the company stated that its board of directors authorized the repurchase of up to $400 million in common shares, and clarified that this initiative is separate from its cryptocurrency ambitions, which include investing more than $2 billion into Bitcoin. Announcement from TMTG After initially denying reports that it planned to raise $3 billion for cryptocurrency investments, Trump Media later confirmed that it secured $2.5 billion in funding for Bitcoin purchases. According to the filing, the company‚Äôs Bitcoin strategy includes a private placement offering amounting to roughly $2.3 billion. These funds were generated through the resale of 56 million shares and 29 million shares linked to convertible notes, based on debt and equity agreements previously registered with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The SEC, which is now chaired by Paul Atkins, approved the registration statement tied to Trump Media‚Äôs Bitcoin initiative earlier this year. The company also submitted applications to launch a spot Bitcoin ETF and, through Truth Social, a dual ETF tied to both Bitcoin and Ethereum. These applications came after the SEC began approving spot Bitcoin ETFs in January of 2024 and spot Ether ETFs in May of 2024. Beyond corporate investments, President Trump proposed the creation of a national ‚ÄúStrategic Bitcoin Reserve‚Äù and a broader ‚ÄúDigital Asset Stockpile‚Äù via a March executive order. These reserves will hold digital assets seized or forfeited to the US government. However, Trump advisers have hinted at broader ambitions for accumulating digital assets beyond legal forfeitures. Critics, including lawmakers on the Senate Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations, accused the president of leveraging his office to financially benefit crypto-aligned entities. Bill Targets Trump‚Äôs Crypto Ties The disapproval of Trump‚Äôs crypto ties is only increasing. California Senator Adam Schiff and nine other Democratic lawmakers recently introduced the COIN Act . This is a bill that is specifically aimed at preventing what they describe as the financial exploitation of digital assets by the US president and other public officials. Announcement from Sen. Adam Schiff The legislation comes in response to the growing concerns over President Donald Trump‚Äôs connections to the cryptocurrency industry, particularly after the disclosure that he earned $57.4 million through World Liberty Financial, a crypto platform backed by members of his family. According to Schiff , Trump‚Äôs involvement with digital assets raised ‚Äúsignificant ethical, legal, and constitutional concerns‚Äù regarding the use of presidential power for personal financial gain. The COIN Act proposes to bar current and former public officials‚Äîincluding presidents and their families‚Äîfrom issuing, sponsoring, or endorsing any form of digital asset like cryptocurrencies, meme coins, NFTs, or stablecoins. These restrictions would apply for a period extending from 180 days before taking office to two years after leaving office. The bill specifically targets payment stablecoins, after WLF‚Äôs announcement of its USD1 stablecoin in March. An Abu Dhabi-based company reportedly planned to use the stablecoin to settle a $2 billion investment on Binance. Additionally, the Trump family‚Äôs ownership stake in WLF reduced from 75% in December to 40% in June, with the divestment potentially netting millions in proceeds. An April report from the State Democracy Defenders Action revealed that Trump‚Äôs digital asset holdings were worth approximately $2.9 billion, and consists of about 40% of his total net worth. The bill by Schiff is one of the Senate‚Äôs earliest attempts to directly confront the president‚Äôs crypto-related financial interests. On the same day, California Representative Maxine Waters introduced a parallel bill in the House called the Stop Trading, Retention, and Unfair Market Payoffs (TRUMP) in Crypto Act. The measure was introduced shortly after Trump held a private dinner to honor top holders of his personal meme coin. Despite their high-profile nature, the future of either bill is still very uncertain. With Democrats in the minority in both chambers of Congress, the legislation faces an uphill battle. Even if it passes the House and Senate, it would likely be vetoed by President Trump. Panther Metals Rides Bitcoin Treasury Wave Trump and TMTG are not alone in their Bitcoin ambitions. Panther Metals Plc, a UK-listed mineral exploration company, also recently unveiled a strategic shift by integrating Bitcoin into its corporate treasury, combining traditional mining operations with digital asset holdings. On Monday, the company announced plans to acquire ¬£4 million ($5.4 million) worth of Bitcoin to position the asset not just as a store of value but as a form of productive capital. As part of this strategy, Panther will use ¬£1.3 million ($1.75 million) in Bitcoin from its treasury as collateral to complete the acquisition of the Pick Lake mining deposit in Ontario, Canada, while maintaining full Bitcoin exposure. Announcement highlights from Panther Metals This move is a departure from the standard Bitcoin treasury model, where companies passively hold the asset. Panther plans to actively leverage Bitcoin to finance high-quality mineral projects, minimizing shareholder dilution by tapping into more favorable terms available in the digital asset market. CEO Darren Hazelwood believes in Bitcoin‚Äôs role as a hedge against inflation and fiat currency volatility, and stated that the hybrid strategy enhances the company‚Äôs resilience and market adaptability. The Pick Lake asset is part of the larger Winston Project, a high-grade, polymetallic zinc, copper, and precious metals deposit. It represents approximately 85% of the project's total mineral resources. Zinc is a key component in galvanizing steel and battery technologies, and is considered a critical mineral, adding even more strategic value to the acquisition. Hazelwood claims the model equips Panther to thrive across varying market cycles. Investor enthusiasm was evident, as shares of Panther Metals (PALM) surged 21% on the London Stock Exchange on Monday. Over the past month, PALM stock climbed 150%, including a 61% rise in just the last week, according to Google Finance. Panther Metals share price over the past month (Source: Google Finance ) Panther now joins a growing list of corporations adopting Bitcoin treasury strategies. Real estate magnate Grant Cardone recently revealed his firm‚Äôs first Bitcoin purchase after acquiring 1,000 BTC for its corporate treasury. Meanwhile, established Bitcoin holders like Michael Saylor‚Äôs Strategy and Japan-based Metaplanet continue to boost their reserves.

headline: Why is the crypto market going up today?
summary: Crypto market recovered as Bitcoin reclaimed the $100k level, following reports of a potential truce between Israel and Iran that may bring an end to the recent ongoing hostilities between the two nations. Major altcoins followed the trend, with XRP ( XRP ), Solana ( SOL ), and Dogecoin ( DOGE ) climbing 8.5%, 8.2%, and 7%, respectively. Meanwhile, Coinglass data shows the average RSI across the market rose to a neutral 58. Open interest also climbed by 4% to $135 billion, while total liquidations dropped 28% to $482 million per CoinGlass data . Interestingly, most of the liquidations came from shorts, indicating a possible short squeeze that may have helped fuel the rally even more. U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs recorded $350.4 million in inflows on Monday, a sharp rise from just $6.37 million on Friday. Ethereum ETFs also saw strong inflows of $100.7 million, reversing from previous day outflows of $11.3 million. Adding to the bullish momentum, Strategy‚Äôs Michael Saylor revealed the company had bought another $26 million worth of Bitcoin. Strategy‚Äôs latest purchase came amid a broader 2025 trend, with more public companies following its lead and adopting Bitcoin as a long-term treasury asset. For instance, Japan‚Äôs Metaplanet recently executed a $108 million purchase , while entrepreneur and investor Anthony Pompliano announced the launch of a Bitcoin treasury firm backed by prominent institutions such as Citadel and Jane Street, with the goal of building a $1 billion Bitcoin reserve. On the regulatory front, the Federal Reserve‚Äôs decision on June 23 to remove the term ‚Äúreputational risk‚Äù from its bank supervision guidelines was seen as a key catalyst. The change eliminates a subjective barrier that had deterred banks from engaging with crypto firms. Industry observers believe this move could normalize banking access for digital asset companies and accelerate crypto-financial integration. summary: The United States Federal Reserve has removed ‚Äúreputational risk‚Äù from its supervisory framework for banks, a decision that could reshape how financial institutions engage with the crypto sector. In a policy update released Monday, the Fed said it will now focus on more specific financial risk discussions instead of the vague and often criticized reputational risk metric. The news of an operational ceasefire between Iran and Israel is a development that demands attention. While specific details of the agreement remain under wraps, the mere confirmation of its implementation phase suggests a de-escalation of tensions that have long simmered in one of the world‚Äôs most sensitive regions. This move could signal a cautious step towards a more stable environment, potentially easing concerns that have weighed on international relations and economic forecasts. Historically, the relationship between Iran and Israel has been characterized by deep-seated animosity and proxy conflicts, contributing to regional instability. Any formal or informal agreement to cease hostilities, even temporarily, can have far-reaching consequences. It‚Äôs not just about the immediate cessation of conflict; it‚Äôs about the potential for reduced uncertainty, which is a commodity highly valued in financial markets. Why Geopolitical Stability Matters for the Global Economy The interconnectedness of the modern world means that events in one region can send shockwaves across continents. Geopolitical stability is a cornerstone of a thriving global economy . When major powers or key regions are embroiled in conflict, several economic consequences typically unfold: Supply Chain Disruptions: Conflicts can impede trade routes, disrupt energy supplies, and affect the movement of goods and services, leading to inflation and shortages. Investor Uncertainty: Heightened tensions cause investors to become risk-averse, pulling capital from speculative or volatile assets and seeking safer havens. Commodity Price Volatility: Prices of essential commodities like oil and gas are particularly sensitive to geopolitical events, as production and transit routes can be threatened. Reduced Consumer Confidence: Economic uncertainty can lead consumers to reduce spending, further dampening economic growth. Conversely, signs of de-escalation or peace often lead to renewed optimism, encouraging investment and fostering economic growth. A ceasefire, even if fragile, can inject a dose of confidence into markets that have been bracing for worse outcomes. Navigating the Crypto Market Impact: Opportunities and Risks So, how does this Iran Israel ceasefire news specifically relate to the cryptocurrency market? The crypto market, despite its decentralized nature, is not immune to global macro events. In fact, it often reacts with amplified volatility due to its relatively smaller market capitalization compared to traditional assets. Here‚Äôs how geopolitical shifts can influence digital assets: Flight to Safe-Haven Assets: During times of extreme uncertainty, investors often seek safe-haven assets . Traditionally, this has been gold, the U.S. dollar, or government bonds. Bitcoin, often dubbed ‚Äòdigital gold,‚Äô has increasingly been considered a safe haven by some, particularly during periods of fiat currency instability or regional conflict. A de-escalation could see some of this ‚Äòsafe-haven‚Äô demand for Bitcoin wane, as investors might rotate back into riskier, higher-yield assets. Risk-On Sentiment: If the ceasefire holds and fosters greater global stability, it could encourage a ‚Äòrisk-on‚Äô sentiment. This means investors might be more willing to allocate capital to growth-oriented and higher-risk assets, which includes cryptocurrencies. Increased investor confidence could lead to broader capital inflows into the crypto ecosystem, potentially boosting prices across the board. Market Volatility: While a ceasefire generally implies positive sentiment, initial reactions can still be volatile as markets digest the news and assess its long-term implications. Traders might take profits on assets that rallied during the period of heightened tension, or new capital might flow in, causing price swings. Altcoin Performance: Bitcoin often leads the market, but altcoins (alternative cryptocurrencies) tend to perform well during periods of broader market optimism. If the ceasefire contributes to sustained positive sentiment, we could see altcoins experiencing significant gains as investor appetite for riskier, higher-reward assets increases. It‚Äôs important to remember that the crypto market is influenced by a multitude of factors, and geopolitical events are just one piece of the puzzle. Regulatory developments, technological advancements, institutional adoption, and broader economic indicators all play significant roles. What are the Challenges and Lingering Questions? While the news of a ceasefire is undoubtedly positive, it‚Äôs crucial to approach it with cautious optimism. Several challenges and questions remain: Fragility of the Ceasefire: Is this a temporary truce or a step towards a more enduring peace? The long history of tensions suggests that any agreement could be fragile and subject to immediate reversal if underlying issues are not addressed. Underlying Issues: A ceasefire addresses immediate hostilities but doesn‚Äôt necessarily resolve the fundamental disagreements and power dynamics that fuel the conflict. Broader Regional Dynamics: The Middle East is a complex region with numerous interconnected conflicts and alliances. This ceasefire, while significant, might not immediately resolve other regional flashpoints. Global Economic Headwinds: Even with improved geopolitical stability, the global economy still faces challenges such as inflation, interest rate hikes, and potential recessions in major economies. These factors will continue to influence market performance, including crypto. Actionable Insights for Crypto Investors Amidst Evolving Geopolitics Given the potential for both positive and negative market reactions to geopolitical news, here are some actionable insights for crypto investors: Stay Informed: Keep a close eye on geopolitical developments, particularly those involving major global powers or regions with significant economic implications. News sources like IRNA, Jin10.com, and CCTV can provide direct updates, but always cross-reference. Diversify Your Portfolio: Don‚Äôt put all your eggs in one basket. A diversified portfolio, including a mix of different cryptocurrencies and potentially traditional assets, can help mitigate risks during volatile periods. Practice Risk Management: Use stop-loss orders, manage your position sizes, and avoid over-leveraging. Geopolitical events can trigger rapid price movements, making robust risk management essential. Long-Term Perspective: For many, cryptocurrencies are a long-term investment. While short-term volatility due to geopolitical news can be unsettling, focusing on the long-term potential of the technology and its adoption can help weather temporary storms. Assess Bitcoin‚Äôs Role: Continue to observe Bitcoin‚Äôs performance during periods of geopolitical stress. Its increasing acceptance as a potential safe-haven asset could further solidify its position in global finance. A Path Towards Stability? The confirmation of an Iran Israel ceasefire entering its implementation phase is a development that brings a cautious sense of relief. While the road ahead remains uncertain and filled with complexities, any step towards de-escalation in a region as pivotal as the Middle East is a positive sign for geopolitical stability and, by extension, the global economy . For the crypto community, this news underscores the profound interconnectedness of world events and the digital asset space. headline: Urgent: Donald Trump Pushes Aggressive Interest Rate Cuts Before Jerome Powell Testimony
summary: BitcoinWorld Urgent: Donald Trump Pushes Aggressive Interest Rate Cuts Before Jerome Powell Testimony In the dynamic world of finance, where every whisper from a key figure can send ripples through global markets, a recent statement from former U.S. President Donald Trump has once again ignited a fiery debate. Ahead of what promises to be a pivotal Jerome Powell Testimony before Congress, Trump has voiced a remarkably strong opinion on the direction of U.S. monetary policy. His insistence on substantial Interest Rate Cuts isn‚Äôt just a political talking point; it‚Äôs a declaration that could significantly influence economic discourse and, by extension, the volatile cryptocurrency landscape. For crypto enthusiasts and investors, understanding these macroeconomic currents is paramount, as central bank actions often dictate the broader liquidity and risk appetite that fuel digital asset markets. Donald Trump‚Äôs Bold Call for Aggressive Interest Rate Cuts On his Truth Social platform, Donald Trump reiterated his firm belief that the Federal Reserve needs to drastically lower interest rates. His specific suggestion of a two to three percentage point reduction is not a minor adjustment but a seismic shift from current levels. Trump argued that such a move could inject massive savings into the U.S. economy, potentially saving the nation an astounding $800 billion annually. His rationale is straightforward: lower rates reduce the cost of borrowing for the government, businesses, and consumers, theoretically stimulating economic activity. He also proposed a flexible approach, suggesting that rates could be increased again if future economic conditions warranted it. This perspective underscores a fundamental divergence from the traditional, independent stance of the Federal Reserve. The Stakes for Jerome Powell‚Äôs Testimony: Navigating Pressure The timing of Trump‚Äôs comments is crucial, coming just before Fed Chair Jerome Powell‚Äôs scheduled testimony before Congress on June 24. Powell‚Äôs appearances before legislative bodies are always closely watched, offering insights into the central bank‚Äôs thinking on inflation, employment, and future monetary policy. However, this testimony carries added weight due to the explicit political pressure from a former President who may yet return to office. The Federal Reserve prides itself on its independence from political influence, making decisions based purely on economic data and its dual mandate of maximizing employment and maintaining price stability. Will Powell address Trump‚Äôs comments directly? How will he balance the Fed‚Äôs independence with the political rhetoric? These are key questions that investors, economists, and even crypto traders will be asking. Key Considerations for Powell‚Äôs Testimony: Inflation Data: Recent inflation figures will heavily influence the Fed‚Äôs stance. Employment Trends: The strength of the job market is another critical factor. Economic Projections: Powell will likely provide updated economic forecasts. Interest Rate Outlook: While he won‚Äôt commit to specific cuts, his language on future policy will be scrutinized. Response to Political Pressure: How he handles questions regarding political influence on Fed decisions. How Federal Reserve Decision-Making Shapes the US Economy Outlook The Federal Reserve Decision to raise or lower interest rates is arguably the most powerful tool in its arsenal for steering the US Economy Outlook . When rates are high, borrowing becomes more expensive, which can cool down an overheating economy and combat inflation. Conversely, lower rates make borrowing cheaper, encouraging spending, investment, and economic growth. Trump‚Äôs call for significant cuts reflects a desire for a more expansionary monetary policy, believing it will unleash economic potential. However, economists often debate the precise impact and potential pitfalls of such aggressive moves. Potential Economic Impacts of Aggressive Rate Cuts: Stimulated Growth: Lower borrowing costs can spur business expansion and consumer spending. Increased Debt: Cheaper money can lead to higher levels of corporate and government debt. Inflationary Pressure: Too much money in circulation can lead to a rise in prices. Dollar Weakness: Lower rates can make the U.S. dollar less attractive, impacting trade. Asset Bubbles: Cheap money can inflate asset prices, potentially leading to bubbles in real estate or stocks. The Fed‚Äôs challenge is to find the ‚ÄòGoldilocks‚Äô zone ‚Äì not too hot, not too cold ‚Äì to ensure sustainable growth without triggering runaway inflation or a recession. This delicate balancing act is what makes every Federal Reserve Decision so impactful. Navigating Interest Rate Cuts: Implications for Crypto Markets For the cryptocurrency community, the prospect of significant Interest Rate Cuts by the Federal Reserve carries profound implications. Crypto assets, particularly Bitcoin and Ethereum, are often viewed as ‚Äòrisk-on‚Äô assets, meaning they tend to perform well when investors have a higher appetite for risk. Lower interest rates typically lead to: Increased Liquidity: When traditional investments offer lower returns, capital often flows into riskier, higher-potential assets like cryptocurrencies. Weaker Dollar: A weaker U.S. dollar, often a consequence of lower rates, can make dollar-denominated assets like Bitcoin more attractive to international investors. Inflation Hedge Narrative: If aggressive rate cuts lead to concerns about inflation, Bitcoin‚Äôs narrative as a digital store of value and inflation hedge could gain traction. Reduced Cost of Capital: For crypto projects and companies, lower rates mean cheaper borrowing, potentially fueling innovation and expansion within the industry. Metaplanet‚Äôs commitment to strengthening its Bitcoin holdings through this substantial capital allocation is a testament to its long-term vision for the cryptocurrency. Metaplanet‚Äôs Pioneering Journey into Bitcoin and Digital Assets For those unfamiliar, Metaplanet has distinguished itself as a trailblazer among publicly traded companies in Japan by adopting Bitcoin as a primary treasury asset. This strategy mirrors that of MicroStrategy in the United States, positioning Metaplanet as a key player in the institutional adoption of cryptocurrencies in Asia. Their initial foray into Bitcoin was driven by a desire to hedge against currency depreciation and seek long-term value appreciation, moving beyond traditional financial instruments. This latest announcement of an additional $5 billion in capital signifies not just a continuation, but a dramatic acceleration of their Bitcoin-centric strategy. It‚Äôs a clear signal that the company sees immense potential in Bitcoin, not merely as a speculative asset, but as a fundamental component of its future financial health. But what exactly makes the U.S. such an attractive destination for a Japanese firm looking to bolster its crypto holdings? Several factors likely contribute to this strategic choice: Regulatory Clarity (Comparatively): While the U.S. regulatory landscape for cryptocurrencies is still evolving, it has seen significant developments, particularly with the approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs. This has provided a degree of institutional comfort and established clear pathways for large-scale digital asset investments, offering more certainty than many other jurisdictions. Mature Market Infrastructure: The U.S. boasts a robust and sophisticated financial infrastructure, including well-established crypto exchanges, custody solutions, and liquidity providers capable of handling multi-billion dollar transactions. headline: Bitcoin Set for Biggest Mining Difficulty Drop Since July 2021
summary: Mining difficulty on the Bitcoin BTC blockchain is on course to drop by the most since July 2021 after the amount of mining power securing the network slid about 30% in two weeks. According to data from Mempool.space , a downward difficulty adjustment of around 9% is projected within the next five days. That would be the most since the China mining ban four years ago, when the hashrate, the total computational power used to mine blocks, plummeted 50% to 58 exahashes per second (EH/s) and bitcoin was trading near $30,000. The difficulty adjusts every 2,016 blocks to ensure that blocks continue to be mined at roughly 10-minute intervals. After the recent decline, the hashrate is now just under 700 EH/s, according to Glassnode data. The largest cryptocurrency by market cap was trading recently around $105,300. Significant hashrate and difficulty corrections are not unusual during the northern hemisphere's summer. Elevated electricity prices, driven by higher air conditioning demand and strained power grids, often lead miners to temporarily shut off machines, especially older or less efficient ones. This seasonal pattern has been observed in several previous years. The anticipated drop in mining difficulty will provide meaningful relief for miners. The hashprice, or miner revenue per exahash, currently sits at $51.9. This metric reflects the estimated daily income in dollars a miner earns per EH/s contributed to the network, based on block rewards and transaction fees. As difficulty decreases, mining becomes easier, meaning miners can earn more revenue for the same amount of computational effort. Assuming bitcoin‚Äôs price and transaction fees remain stable or increase, the hashprice should rise significantly in the coming days, helping to offset recent profitability pressure.

headline: Crypto tax Australia: How does Australia tax their crypto?
summary: A recent ruling in a criminal court case classified crypto assets as money, which goes against the long-held crypto tax Australian office that counts crypto as capital gains. A court decision involving a federal police officer who allegedly stole 81.6 BTC in 2019 has resurfaced as more traders are contesting how cryptocurrency should be taxed in Australia . On May 19, Judge Michael O‚ÄôConnell ruled that Bitcoin ( BTC ) should be treated as money rather than a taxable asset. This means that the judge declared that Bitcoin is more similar to the Australian dollar, rather than a speculative asset like gold , shares or foreign currency. According to the Australian Taxation Office website , crypto tax Australia classifies crypto under property instead of currency. More specifically, crypto falls under capital gains tax under the current framework used by the taxation office. You might also like: South Korea to postpone Crypto Tax bill to 2027 As of June 24, the website still categorizes crypto under property with capital gains on swaps, DeFi, and wrapped tokens. However the ruling could mean that Bitcoin falls under fiat currency, potentially exempting it from the current capital gains tax framework. How is crypto tax Australia operated? Under the current framework, crypto is seen as an investment. Therefore, crypto assets fall under the capital gains tax mechanism. According to the website, activities that involve making transactions with crypto ‚Äîsuch as selling, swapping or spending crypto‚Äî is considered a capital gains tax event. On the other hand, the revenue generated from mining, staking, or earning crypto counts as ordinary income instead of capital gains. In those cases, then the ordinary income tax would be applied to the profit. However, crypto assets meant for personal use with a value of below AUD 10,000 ($6,503) is considered an exemption to the capital gains tax. But anything above the threshold would be subject to CGT under the crypto tax Australia framework. Most recently, Australia introduced cash transaction limits for crypto ATMs. The regulation mandates crypto ATM operators to implement a cash deposit and withdrawal cap of 5,000 Australian dollars or equal to $3,251. Not only that, operators must also display notices, warning users of potential fraud risks. You might also like: Crypto ATM operators in Australia hit with cash limits and tougher compliance checks
